message_2:
To solve the inequality 2x + 3 > 5x - 7, we need to isolate x on one side of the inequality. 

Step 1: Subtract 2x from both sides of the inequality.
3 > 3x - 7

Step 2: Add 7 to both sides of the inequality.
10 > 3x

Step 3: Divide both sides of the inequality by 3.
10/3 > x

So, the solution to the inequality is x < 10/3.
